intro: Senecio bivestitus, commonly known as the white-flowered groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Senecio bivestitus is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, making it a distinctive feature in its native habitat.
